  <COMMENT line1="168" col1="1" line2="168" col2="80" start="31753" end="31832">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="169" col1="1" line2="169" col2="36" start="31942" end="31977">### Generic plot function for SCESet</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="171" col1="1" line2="171" col2="47" start="32320" end="32366">#' Plot an overview of expression for each cell</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="172" col1="1" line2="172" col2="2" start="32509" end="32510">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="173" col1="1" line2="173" col2="79" start="32698" end="32776">#' Plot the relative proportion of the library accounted for by the most highly</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="174" col1="1" line2="174" col2="65" start="32887" end="32951">#' expressed features for each cell for an \code{SCESet} dataset.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="175" col1="1" line2="175" col2="2" start="33076" end="33077">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="176" col1="1" line2="176" col2="35" start="33265" end="33299">#' @param x an \code{SCESet} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="177" col1="1" line2="177" col2="80" start="33454" end="33533">#' @param block1 character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="178" col1="1" line2="178" col2="75" start="33643" end="33717">#' be used as a factor by which to separate the cells into blocks (separate</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="179" col1="1" line2="179" col2="73" start="33832" end="33904">#' panels) in the plot. Default is \code{NULL}, in which case there is no</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="180" col1="1" line2="180" col2="12" start="34021" end="34032">#' blocking.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="181" col1="1" line2="181" col2="80" start="34210" end="34289">#' @param block2 character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="182" col1="1" line2="182" col2="75" start="34399" end="34473">#' be used as a factor by which to separate the cells into blocks (separate</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="183" col1="1" line2="183" col2="73" start="34588" end="34660">#' panels) in the plot. Default is \code{NULL}, in which case there is no</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="184" col1="1" line2="184" col2="12" start="34777" end="34788">#' blocking.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="185" col1="1" line2="185" col2="83" start="34966" end="35048">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="186" col1="1" line2="186" col2="81" start="35155" end="35235">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively, </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="187" col1="1" line2="187" col2="80" start="35344" end="35423">#' a data frame with one column containing a value for each cell, which will be </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="188" col1="1" line2="188" col2="36" start="35533" end="35568">#' mapped to a corresponding colour.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="189" col1="1" line2="189" col2="79" start="35722" end="35800">#' @param nfeatures numeric scalar indicating the number of features to include</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="190" col1="1" line2="190" col2="15" start="35911" end="35925">#' in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="191" col1="1" line2="191" col2="78" start="36100" end="36177">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="192" col1="1" line2="192" col2="75" start="36289" end="36363">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="193" col1="1" line2="193" col2="73" start="36478" end="36550">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"counts"} (raw counts), \code{"cpm"} </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="194" col1="1" line2="194" col2="82" start="36667" end="36748">#' (counts per million), \code{"fpkm"} (FPKM values), or \code{"exprs"} (default; </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="195" col1="1" line2="195" col2="85" start="36856" end="36940">#' which are assumed to be on the log2 scale and are un-logged prior to plotting). If</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="196" col1="1" line2="196" col2="79" start="37045" end="37123">#' not specified, the function will search for values in the order given above.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="197" col1="1" line2="197" col2="74" start="37234" end="37307">#' @param linewidth numeric scalar giving the "size" parameter (in ggplot2</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="198" col1="1" line2="198" col2="51" start="37423" end="37473">#' parlance) for the lines plotted. Default is 1.5.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="199" col1="1" line2="199" col2="77" start="37612" end="37688">#' @param y optional argument for generic \code{plot} functions, not used for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="200" col1="1" line2="200" col2="35" start="37801" end="37835">#' plotting an \code{SCESet} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="201" col1="1" line2="201" col2="51" start="37990" end="38040">#' @param ... arguments passed to \code{plotSCESet}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="202" col1="1" line2="202" col2="82" start="38179" end="38260">#' @param ncol number of columns to use for \code{facet_wrap} if only one block is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="203" col1="1" line2="203" col2="11" start="38368" end="38378">#' defined.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="204" col1="1" line2="204" col2="76" start="38557" end="38632">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving font size to use for the plotting</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="205" col1="1" line2="205" col2="8" start="38746" end="38753">#' theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="206" col1="1" line2="206" col2="2" start="38935" end="38936">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="207" col1="1" line2="207" col2="79" start="39124" end="39202">#' @details Plots produced by this function are intended to provide an overview</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="208" col1="1" line2="208" col2="76" start="39313" end="39388">#' of large-scale differences between cells. For each cell, the features are</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="209" col1="1" line2="209" col2="79" start="39502" end="39580">#' ordered from most-expressed to least-expressed and the cumulative proportion</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="210" col1="1" line2="210" col2="66" start="39691" end="39756">#' of the total expression for the cell is computed across the top</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="211" col1="1" line2="211" col2="73" start="39880" end="39952">#' \code{nfeatures} features. These plots can flag cells with a very high</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="212" col1="1" line2="212" col2="79" start="40069" end="40147">#' proportion of the library coming from a small number of features; such cells</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="213" col1="1" line2="213" col2="75" start="40258" end="40332">#' are likely to be problematic for analyses. Using the colour and blocking</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="214" col1="1" line2="214" col2="79" start="40447" end="40525">#' arguments can flag overall differences in cells under different experimental</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="215" col1="1" line2="215" col2="65" start="40636" end="40700">#' conditions or affected by different batch and other variables.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="216" col1="1" line2="216" col2="2" start="40825" end="40826">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="217" col1="1" line2="217" col2="31" start="41014" end="41044">#' @return a ggplot plot object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="218" col1="1" line2="218" col2="2" start="41203" end="41204">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="219" col1="1" line2="219" col2="13" start="41392" end="41404">#' @name plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="220" col1="1" line2="220" col2="58" start="41581" end="41638">#' @aliases plot plot,SCESet-method plot,SCESet,ANY-method</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="221" col1="1" line2="221" col2="10" start="41770" end="41779">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="222" col1="1" line2="222" col2="34" start="41959" end="41992">#' @method plot plot,SCESet-method</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="223" col1="1" line2="223" col2="2" start="42148" end="42149">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="224" col1="1" line2="224" col2="12" start="42337" end="42348">#' @examples</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="225" col1="1" line2="225" col2="30" start="42526" end="42555">#' ## Set up an example SCESet</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="230" col1="1" line2="230" col2="2" start="43471" end="43472">#'</COMMENT>

    <OP-COMMA line1="240" col1="38" line2="240" col2="38" start="45398" end="45398">,</OP-COMMA>
    <expr line1="241" col1="11" line2="243" col2="11" start="45560" end="45938">

      <expr line1="241" col1="28" line2="243" col2="11" start="45577" end="45938">

  <COMMENT line1="353" col1="1" line2="353" col2="80" start="66718" end="66797">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="355" col1="1" line2="355" col2="32" start="67096" end="67127">#' Plot PCA for an SCESet object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="356" col1="1" line2="356" col2="2" start="67285" end="67286">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="357" col1="1" line2="357" col2="78" start="67474" end="67551">#' Produce a principal components analysis (PCA) plot of two or more principal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="358" col1="1" line2="358" col2="43" start="67663" end="67705">#' components for an \code{SCESet} dataset.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="359" col1="1" line2="359" col2="2" start="67852" end="67853">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="360" col1="1" line2="360" col2="40" start="68041" end="68080">#' @param object an \code{SCESet} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="361" col1="1" line2="361" col2="80" start="68230" end="68309">#' @param ntop numeric scalar indicating the number of most variable features to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="362" col1="1" line2="362" col2="74" start="68419" end="68492">#' use for the PCA. Default is \code{500}, but any \code{ntop} argument is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="363" col1="1" line2="363" col2="60" start="68608" end="68667">#' overrided if the \code{feature_set} argument is non-NULL.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="364" col1="1" line2="364" col2="71" start="68797" end="68867">#' @param ncomponents numeric scalar indicating the number of principal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="365" col1="1" line2="365" col2="78" start="68986" end="69063">#' components to plot, starting from the first principal component. Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="366" col1="1" line2="366" col2="79" start="69175" end="69253">#' 2. If \code{ncomponents} is 2, then a scatterplot of PC2 vs PC1 is produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="367" col1="1" line2="367" col2="80" start="69364" end="69443">#' If \code{ncomponents} is greater than 2, a pairs plots for the top components</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="368" col1="1" line2="368" col2="15" start="69553" end="69567">#' is produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="369" col1="1" line2="369" col2="78" start="69742" end="69819">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="370" col1="1" line2="370" col2="75" start="69931" end="70005">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="371" col1="1" line2="371" col2="63" start="70120" end="70182">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"norm_tpm"} (normalised TPM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="372" col1="1" line2="372" col2="76" start="70309" end="70384">#' values), \code{"fpkm"} (FPKM values), \code{"norm_fpkm"} (normalised FPKM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="373" col1="1" line2="373" col2="76" start="70498" end="70573">#' values), \code{"counts"} (counts for each feature), \code{"norm_counts"},</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="374" col1="1" line2="374" col2="67" start="70687" end="70753">#' \code{"cpm"} (counts-per-million), \code{"norm_cpm"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="375" col1="1" line2="375" col2="78" start="70876" end="70953">#' counts-per-million), \code{"exprs"} (whatever is in the \code{'exprs'} slot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="376" col1="1" line2="376" col2="73" start="71065" end="71137">#' of the \code{SCESet} object; default), \code{"norm_exprs"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="377" col1="1" line2="377" col2="78" start="71254" end="71331">#' expression values) or \code{"stand_exprs"} (standardised expression values)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="378" col1="1" line2="378" col2="79" start="71443" end="71521">#' or any other named element of the \code{assayData} slot of the \code{SCESet}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="379" col1="1" line2="379" col2="66" start="71632" end="71697">#' object that can be accessed with the \code{get_exprs} function.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="380" col1="1" line2="380" col2="83" start="71821" end="71903">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="381" col1="1" line2="381" col2="81" start="72010" end="72090">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively, </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="382" col1="1" line2="382" col2="83" start="72199" end="72281">#' a data frame with one column, containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="383" col1="1" line2="383" col2="82" start="72388" end="72469">#' @param shape_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="384" col1="1" line2="384" col2="78" start="72577" end="72654">#' be used as a factor by which to define the shape of the points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="385" col1="1" line2="385" col2="82" start="72766" end="72847">#' Alternatively, a data frame with one column containing values to map to shapes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="386" col1="1" line2="386" col2="81" start="72955" end="73035">#' @param size_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="387" col1="1" line2="387" col2="73" start="73144" end="73216">#' be used as a factor by which to define the size of points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="388" col1="1" line2="388" col2="81" start="73333" end="73413">#' Alternatively, a data frame with one column containing values to map to sizes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="389" col1="1" line2="389" col2="78" start="73522" end="73599">#' @param feature_set character, numeric or logical vector indicating a set of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="390" col1="1" line2="390" col2="68" start="73711" end="73778">#' features to use for the PCA. If character, entries must all be in</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="391" col1="1" line2="391" col2="78" start="73900" end="73977">#' \code{featureNames(object)}. If numeric, values are taken to be indices for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="392" col1="1" line2="392" col2="80" start="74089" end="74168">#' features. If logical, vector is used to index features and should have length</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="393" col1="1" line2="393" col2="32" start="74278" end="74309">#' equal to \code{nrow(object)}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="394" col1="1" line2="394" col2="76" start="74467" end="74542">#' @param return_SCESet logical, should the function return an \code{SCESet}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="395" col1="1" line2="395" col2="58" start="74656" end="74713">#' object with principal component values for cells in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="396" col1="1" line2="396" col2="73" start="74845" end="74917">#' \code{reducedDimension} slot. Default is \code{FALSE}, in which case a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="397" col1="1" line2="397" col2="36" start="75034" end="75069">#' \code{ggplot} object is returned.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="398" col1="1" line2="398" col2="78" start="75223" end="75300">#' @param scale_features logical, should the expression values be standardised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="399" col1="1" line2="399" col2="66" start="75412" end="75477">#' so that each feature has unit variance? Default is \code{TRUE}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="400" col1="1" line2="400" col2="77" start="75601" end="75677">#' @param draw_plot logical, should the plot be drawn on the current graphics</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="401" col1="1" line2="401" col2="79" start="75790" end="75868">#' device? Only used if \code{return_SCESet} is \code{TRUE}, otherwise the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="402" col1="1" line2="402" col2="22" start="75979" end="76000">#' is always produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="403" col1="1" line2="403" col2="78" start="76168" end="76245">#' @param pca_data_input character argument defining which data should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="404" col1="1" line2="404" col2="77" start="76357" end="76433">#' as input for the PCA. Possible options are \code{"exprs"} (default), which</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="405" col1="1" line2="405" col2="80" start="76546" end="76625">#' uses expression data to produce a PCA at the cell level; \code{"pdata"} which</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="406" col1="1" line2="406" col2="80" start="76735" end="76814">#' uses numeric variables from \code{pData(object)} to do PCA at the cell level;</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="407" col1="1" line2="407" col2="79" start="76924" end="77002">#' and \code{"fdata"} which uses numeric variables from \code{fData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="408" col1="1" line2="408" col2="31" start="77113" end="77143">#' do PCA at the feature level.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="409" col1="1" line2="409" col2="75" start="77302" end="77376">#' @param selected_variables character vector indicating which variables in</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="410" col1="1" line2="410" col2="75" start="77491" end="77565">#' \code{pData(object)} to use for the phenotype-data based PCA. Ignored if</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="411" col1="1" line2="411" col2="76" start="77680" end="77755">#' the argument \code{pca_data_input} is anything other than \code{"pdata"}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="412" col1="1" line2="412" col2="78" start="77869" end="77946">#' @param detect_outliers logical, should outliers be detected in the PC plot?</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="413" col1="1" line2="413" col2="80" start="78058" end="78137">#' Only an option when \code{pca_data_input} argument is \code{"pdata"}. Default</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="414" col1="1" line2="414" col2="19" start="78247" end="78265">#' is \code{FALSE}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="415" col1="1" line2="415" col2="79" start="78436" end="78514">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="416" col1="1" line2="416" col2="19" start="78625" end="78643">#' (default is 10).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="417" col1="1" line2="417" col2="77" start="78814" end="78890">#' @param legend character, specifying how the legend(s) be shown? Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="418" col1="1" line2="418" col2="80" start="79003" end="79082">#' \code{"auto"}, which hides legends that have only one level and shows others.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="419" col1="1" line2="419" col2="74" start="79192" end="79265">#' Alternatives are "all" (show all legends) or "none" (hide all legends).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="420" col1="1" line2="420" col2="2" start="79381" end="79382">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="421" col1="1" line2="421" col2="79" start="79570" end="79648">#' @details The function \code{\link{prcomp}} is used internally to do the PCA.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="422" col1="1" line2="422" col2="65" start="79759" end="79823">#' The function checks whether the \code{object} has standardised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="423" col1="1" line2="423" col2="76" start="79948" end="80023">#' expression values (by looking at \code{stand_exprs(object)}). If yes, the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="424" col1="1" line2="424" col2="77" start="80137" end="80213">#' existing standardised expression values are used for the PCA. If not, then</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="425" col1="1" line2="425" col2="78" start="80326" end="80403">#' standardised expression values are computed using \code{\link{scale}} (with</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="426" col1="1" line2="426" col2="76" start="80515" end="80590">#' feature-wise unit variances or not according to the \code{scale_features}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="427" col1="1" line2="427" col2="78" start="80704" end="80781">#' argument), added to the object and PCA is done using these new standardised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="428" col1="1" line2="428" col2="21" start="80893" end="80913">#' expression values.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="429" col1="1" line2="429" col2="2" start="81082" end="81083">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="430" col1="1" line2="430" col2="76" start="81271" end="81346">#' If the arguments \code{detect_outliers} and \code{return_SCESet} are both</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="431" col1="1" line2="431" col2="70" start="81460" end="81529">#' \code{TRUE}, then the element \code{$outlier} is added to the pData</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="432" col1="1" line2="432" col2="75" start="81649" end="81723">#' (phenotype data) slot of the \code{SCESet} object. This element contains</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="433" col1="1" line2="433" col2="76" start="81838" end="81913">#' indicator values about whether or not each cell has been designated as an</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="434" col1="1" line2="434" col2="71" start="82027" end="82097">#' outlier based on the PCA. These values can be accessed for filtering</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="435" col1="1" line2="435" col2="70" start="82216" end="82285">#' low quality cells with, foe example, \code{example_sceset$outlier}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="436" col1="1" line2="436" col2="2" start="82405" end="82406">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="437" col1="1" line2="437" col2="58" start="82594" end="82651">#' @return either a ggplot plot object or an SCESet object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="438" col1="1" line2="438" col2="2" start="82783" end="82784">#'</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="689" col1="1" line2="689" col2="80" start="130222" end="130301">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="690" col1="1" line2="690" col2="12" start="130411" end="130422">### plotTSNE</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="692" col1="1" line2="692" col2="34" start="130789" end="130822">#' Plot t-SNE for an SCESet object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="693" col1="1" line2="693" col2="2" start="130978" end="130979">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="694" col1="1" line2="694" col2="77" start="131167" end="131243">#' Produce a t-distributed stochastic neighbour embedding (t-SNE) plot of two</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="695" col1="1" line2="695" col2="43" start="131356" end="131398">#' components for an \code{SCESet} dataset.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="696" col1="1" line2="696" col2="2" start="131545" end="131546">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="697" col1="1" line2="697" col2="40" start="131734" end="131773">#' @param object an \code{SCESet} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="698" col1="1" line2="698" col2="80" start="131923" end="132002">#' @param ntop numeric scalar indicating the number of most variable features to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="699" col1="1" line2="699" col2="75" start="132112" end="132186">#' use for the t-SNE Default is \code{500}, but any \code{ntop} argument is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="700" col1="1" line2="700" col2="60" start="132301" end="132360">#' overrided if the \code{feature_set} argument is non-NULL.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="701" col1="1" line2="701" col2="67" start="132490" end="132556">#' @param ncomponents numeric scalar indicating the number of t-SNE</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="702" col1="1" line2="702" col2="74" start="132679" end="132752">#' components to plot, starting from the first t-SNE component. Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="703" col1="1" line2="703" col2="80" start="132868" end="132947">#' 2. If \code{ncomponents} is 2, then a scatterplot of component 1 vs component</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="704" col1="1" line2="704" col2="80" start="133057" end="133136">#' 2 is produced. If \code{ncomponents} is greater than 2, a pairs plots for the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="705" col1="1" line2="705" col2="79" start="133246" end="133324">#' top components is produced. NB: computing more than two components for t-SNE</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="706" col1="1" line2="706" col2="34" start="133435" end="133468">#' can become very time consuming.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="707" col1="1" line2="707" col2="78" start="133624" end="133701">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="708" col1="1" line2="708" col2="75" start="133813" end="133887">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="709" col1="1" line2="709" col2="63" start="134002" end="134064">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"norm_tpm"} (normalised TPM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="710" col1="1" line2="710" col2="76" start="134191" end="134266">#' values), \code{"fpkm"} (FPKM values), \code{"norm_fpkm"} (normalised FPKM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="711" col1="1" line2="711" col2="76" start="134380" end="134455">#' values), \code{"counts"} (counts for each feature), \code{"norm_counts"},</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="712" col1="1" line2="712" col2="67" start="134569" end="134635">#' \code{"cpm"} (counts-per-million), \code{"norm_cpm"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="713" col1="1" line2="713" col2="78" start="134758" end="134835">#' counts-per-million), \code{"exprs"} (whatever is in the \code{'exprs'} slot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="714" col1="1" line2="714" col2="73" start="134947" end="135019">#' of the \code{SCESet} object; default), \code{"norm_exprs"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="715" col1="1" line2="715" col2="79" start="135136" end="135214">#' expression values) or \code{"stand_exprs"} (standardised expression values),</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="716" col1="1" line2="716" col2="79" start="135325" end="135403">#' or any other named element of the \code{assayData} slot of the \code{SCESet}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="717" col1="1" line2="717" col2="66" start="135514" end="135579">#' object that can be accessed with the \code{get_exprs} function.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="718" col1="1" line2="718" col2="83" start="135703" end="135785">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="719" col1="1" line2="719" col2="81" start="135892" end="135972">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively, </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="720" col1="1" line2="720" col2="82" start="136081" end="136162">#' a data frame with one column containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="721" col1="1" line2="721" col2="82" start="136270" end="136351">#' @param shape_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="722" col1="1" line2="722" col2="78" start="136459" end="136536">#' be used as a factor by which to define the shape of the points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="723" col1="1" line2="723" col2="83" start="136648" end="136730">#' Alternatively, a data frame with one column containing values to map to shapes. </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="724" col1="1" line2="724" col2="81" start="136837" end="136917">#' @param size_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="725" col1="1" line2="725" col2="73" start="137026" end="137098">#' be used as a factor by which to define the size of points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="726" col1="1" line2="726" col2="81" start="137215" end="137295">#' Alternatively, a data frame with one column containing values to map to sizes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="727" col1="1" line2="727" col2="78" start="137404" end="137481">#' @param feature_set character, numeric or logical vector indicating a set of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="728" col1="1" line2="728" col2="79" start="137593" end="137671">#' features to use for the t-SNE calculation. If character, entries must all be</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="729" col1="1" line2="729" col2="81" start="137782" end="137862">#' in \code{featureNames(object)}. If numeric, values are taken to be indices for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="730" col1="1" line2="730" col2="80" start="137971" end="138050">#' features. If logical, vector is used to index features and should have length</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="731" col1="1" line2="731" col2="32" start="138160" end="138191">#' equal to \code{nrow(object)}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="732" col1="1" line2="732" col2="76" start="138349" end="138424">#' @param return_SCESet logical, should the function return an \code{SCESet}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="733" col1="1" line2="733" col2="58" start="138538" end="138595">#' object with principal component values for cells in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="734" col1="1" line2="734" col2="73" start="138727" end="138799">#' \code{reducedDimension} slot. Default is \code{FALSE}, in which case a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="735" col1="1" line2="735" col2="36" start="138916" end="138951">#' \code{ggplot} object is returned.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="736" col1="1" line2="736" col2="78" start="139105" end="139182">#' @param scale_features logical, should the expression values be standardised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="737" col1="1" line2="737" col2="66" start="139294" end="139359">#' so that each feature has unit variance? Default is \code{TRUE}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="738" col1="1" line2="738" col2="77" start="139483" end="139559">#' @param draw_plot logical, should the plot be drawn on the current graphics</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="739" col1="1" line2="739" col2="79" start="139672" end="139750">#' device? Only used if \code{return_SCESet} is \code{TRUE}, otherwise the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="740" col1="1" line2="740" col2="22" start="139861" end="139882">#' is always produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="741" col1="1" line2="741" col2="79" start="140050" end="140128">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="742" col1="1" line2="742" col2="19" start="140239" end="140257">#' (default is 10).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="743" col1="1" line2="743" col2="67" start="140428" end="140494">#' @param rand_seed (optional) numeric scalar that can be passed to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="744" col1="1" line2="744" col2="46" start="140617" end="140662">#' \code{set.seed} to make plots reproducible.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="745" col1="1" line2="745" col2="77" start="140806" end="140882">#' @param perplexity numeric scalar value defining the "perplexity parameter"</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="746" col1="1" line2="746" col2="79" start="140995" end="141073">#' for the t-SNE plot. Passed to \code{\link[Rtsne]{Rtsne}} - see documentation</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="747" col1="1" line2="747" col2="37" start="141184" end="141220">#' for that package for more details.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="748" col1="1" line2="748" col2="77" start="141373" end="141449">#' @param legend character, specifying how the legend(s) be shown? Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="749" col1="1" line2="749" col2="80" start="141562" end="141641">#' \code{"auto"}, which hides legends that have only one level and shows others.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="750" col1="1" line2="750" col2="74" start="141751" end="141824">#' Alternatives are "all" (show all legends) or "none" (hide all legends).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="751" col1="1" line2="751" col2="68" start="141940" end="142007">#' @param ... further arguments passed to \code{\link[Rtsne]{Rtsne}}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="752" col1="1" line2="752" col2="2" start="142129" end="142130">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="753" col1="1" line2="753" col2="73" start="142318" end="142390">#' @details The function \code{\link[Rtsne]{Rtsne}} is used internally to</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="755" col1="1" line2="755" col2="2" start="142696" end="142697">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="756" col1="1" line2="756" col2="79" start="142885" end="142963">#' @return If \code{return_SCESet} is \code{TRUE}, then the function returns an</COMMENT>

                  <expr line1="881" col1="29" line2="881" col2="36" start="166538" end="166545">
                    <SYMBOL line1="881" col1="29" line2="881" col2="36" start="166538" end="166545">tsne_out</SYMBOL>
                  </expr>
                  <OP-DOLLAR line1="881" col1="37" line2="881" col2="37" start="166546" end="166546">$</OP-DOLLAR>
                  <SYMBOL line1="881" col1="38" line2="881" col2="38" start="166547" end="166547">Y</SYMBOL>
                </expr>
                <OP-LEFT-BRACKET line1="881" col1="39" line2="881" col2="39" start="166548" end="166548">[</OP-LEFT-BRACKET>
                <OP-COMMA line1="881" col1="40" line2="881" col2="40" start="166549" end="166549">,</OP-COMMA>
                <expr line1="881" col1="42" line2="881" col2="54" start="166551" end="166563">

                  </expr>
                  <OP-COLON line1="881" col1="43" line2="881" col2="43" start="166552" end="166552">:</OP-COLON>

                  </expr>
                </expr>
                <OP-RIGHT-BRACKET line1="881" col1="55" line2="881" col2="55" start="166564" end="166564">]</OP-RIGHT-BRACKET>
              </expr>
            </expr>
            <expr line1="882" col1="19" line2="882" col2="57" start="166717" end="166755">

              </expr>

          </expr>
        </expr>

      </expr>
    </expr>

  </expr>
  <COMMENT line1="893" col1="1" line2="893" col2="80" start="168778" end="168857">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="894" col1="1" line2="894" col2="20" start="168967" end="168986">### plotDiffusionMap</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="896" col1="1" line2="896" col2="44" start="169345" end="169388">#' Plot a diffusion map for an SCESet object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="897" col1="1" line2="897" col2="2" start="169534" end="169535">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="898" col1="1" line2="898" col2="79" start="169723" end="169801">#' Produce a diffusion map plot of two components for an \code{SCESet} dataset.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="899" col1="1" line2="899" col2="2" start="169912" end="169913">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="900" col1="1" line2="900" col2="40" start="170101" end="170140">#' @param object an \code{SCESet} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="901" col1="1" line2="901" col2="80" start="170290" end="170369">#' @param ntop numeric scalar indicating the number of most variable features to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="902" col1="1" line2="902" col2="72" start="170479" end="170550">#' use for the diffusion map. Default is \code{500}, but any \code{ntop}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="903" col1="1" line2="903" col2="72" start="170668" end="170739">#' argument is overrided if the \code{feature_set} argument is non-NULL.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="904" col1="1" line2="904" col2="71" start="170857" end="170927">#' @param ncomponents numeric scalar indicating the number of principal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="905" col1="1" line2="905" col2="79" start="171046" end="171124">#' components to plot, starting from the first diffusion map component. Default</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="906" col1="1" line2="906" col2="73" start="171235" end="171307">#' is 2. If \code{ncomponents} is 2, then a scatterplot of component 1 vs</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="907" col1="1" line2="907" col2="76" start="171424" end="171499">#' component 2 is produced. If \code{ncomponents} is greater than 2, a pairs</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="908" col1="1" line2="908" col2="78" start="171613" end="171690">#' plots for the top components is produced. NB: computing many components for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="909" col1="1" line2="909" col2="47" start="171802" end="171848">#' the diffusion map can become time consuming.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="910" col1="1" line2="910" col2="78" start="171991" end="172068">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="911" col1="1" line2="911" col2="75" start="172180" end="172254">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="912" col1="1" line2="912" col2="63" start="172369" end="172431">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"norm_tpm"} (normalised TPM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="913" col1="1" line2="913" col2="76" start="172558" end="172633">#' values), \code{"fpkm"} (FPKM values), \code{"norm_fpkm"} (normalised FPKM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="914" col1="1" line2="914" col2="76" start="172747" end="172822">#' values), \code{"counts"} (counts for each feature), \code{"norm_counts"},</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="915" col1="1" line2="915" col2="67" start="172936" end="173002">#' \code{"cpm"} (counts-per-million), \code{"norm_cpm"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="916" col1="1" line2="916" col2="78" start="173125" end="173202">#' counts-per-million), \code{"exprs"} (whatever is in the \code{'exprs'} slot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="917" col1="1" line2="917" col2="73" start="173314" end="173386">#' of the \code{SCESet} object; default), \code{"norm_exprs"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="918" col1="1" line2="918" col2="78" start="173503" end="173580">#' expression values) or \code{"stand_exprs"} (standardised expression values)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="919" col1="1" line2="919" col2="79" start="173692" end="173770">#' or any other named element of the \code{assayData} slot of the \code{SCESet}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="920" col1="1" line2="920" col2="66" start="173881" end="173946">#' object that can be accessed with the \code{get_exprs} function.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="921" col1="1" line2="921" col2="83" start="174070" end="174152">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="922" col1="1" line2="922" col2="82" start="174259" end="174340">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively, a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="923" col1="1" line2="923" col2="80" start="174448" end="174527">#' data frame with one column containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="924" col1="1" line2="924" col2="82" start="174637" end="174718">#' @param shape_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="925" col1="1" line2="925" col2="78" start="174826" end="174903">#' be used as a factor by which to define the shape of the points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="926" col1="1" line2="926" col2="81" start="175015" end="175095">#' @param size_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="927" col1="1" line2="927" col2="73" start="175204" end="175276">#' be used as a factor by which to define the size of points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="928" col1="1" line2="928" col2="78" start="175393" end="175470">#' @param feature_set character, numeric or logical vector indicating a set of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="929" col1="1" line2="929" col2="78" start="175582" end="175659">#' features to use for the diffusion map. If character, entries must all be in</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="930" col1="1" line2="930" col2="78" start="175771" end="175848">#' \code{featureNames(object)}. If numeric, values are taken to be indices for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="931" col1="1" line2="931" col2="80" start="175960" end="176039">#' features. If logical, vector is used to index features and should have length</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="932" col1="1" line2="932" col2="32" start="176149" end="176180">#' equal to \code{nrow(object)}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="933" col1="1" line2="933" col2="76" start="176338" end="176413">#' @param return_SCESet logical, should the function return an \code{SCESet}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="934" col1="1" line2="934" col2="58" start="176527" end="176584">#' object with principal component values for cells in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="935" col1="1" line2="935" col2="73" start="176716" end="176788">#' \code{reducedDimension} slot. Default is \code{FALSE}, in which case a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="936" col1="1" line2="936" col2="36" start="176905" end="176940">#' \code{ggplot} object is returned.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="937" col1="1" line2="937" col2="78" start="177094" end="177171">#' @param scale_features logical, should the expression values be standardised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="938" col1="1" line2="938" col2="66" start="177283" end="177348">#' so that each feature has unit variance? Default is \code{TRUE}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="939" col1="1" line2="939" col2="77" start="177472" end="177548">#' @param draw_plot logical, should the plot be drawn on the current graphics</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="940" col1="1" line2="940" col2="79" start="177661" end="177739">#' device? Only used if \code{return_SCESet} is \code{TRUE}, otherwise the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="941" col1="1" line2="941" col2="22" start="177850" end="177871">#' is always produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="942" col1="1" line2="942" col2="79" start="178039" end="178117">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="943" col1="1" line2="943" col2="19" start="178228" end="178246">#' (default is 10).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="944" col1="1" line2="944" col2="67" start="178417" end="178483">#' @param rand_seed (optional) numeric scalar that can be passed to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="945" col1="1" line2="945" col2="46" start="178606" end="178651">#' \code{set.seed} to make plots reproducible.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="946" col1="1" line2="946" col2="70" start="178795" end="178864">#' @param sigma argument passed to \code{\link[destiny]{DiffusionMap}}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="947" col1="1" line2="947" col2="73" start="178984" end="179056">#' @param distance argument passed to \code{\link[destiny]{DiffusionMap}}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="948" col1="1" line2="948" col2="77" start="179173" end="179249">#' @param legend character, specifying how the legend(s) be shown? Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="949" col1="1" line2="949" col2="80" start="179362" end="179441">#' \code{"auto"}, which hides legends that have only one level and shows others.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="950" col1="1" line2="950" col2="74" start="179551" end="179624">#' Alternatives are "all" (show all legends) or "none" (hide all legends).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="951" col1="1" line2="951" col2="77" start="179740" end="179816">#' @param ... further arguments passed to \code{\link[destiny]{DiffusionMap}}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="952" col1="1" line2="952" col2="2" start="179929" end="179930">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="953" col1="1" line2="953" col2="79" start="180118" end="180196">#' @details The function \code{\link[destiny]{DiffusionMap}} is used internally</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="954" col1="1" line2="954" col2="32" start="180307" end="180338">#' to compute the diffusion map.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="955" col1="1" line2="955" col2="2" start="180496" end="180497">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="956" col1="1" line2="956" col2="79" start="180685" end="180763">#' @return If \code{return_SCESet} is \code{TRUE}, then the function returns an</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="957" col1="1" line2="957" col2="69" start="180874" end="180942">#' \code{SCESet} object, otherwise it returns a \code{ggplot} object.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="958" col1="1" line2="958" col2="25" start="181063" end="181087">#' @name plotDiffusionMap</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="959" col1="1" line2="959" col2="59" start="181252" end="181310">#' @aliases plotDiffusionMap plotDiffusionMap,SCESet-method</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="960" col1="1" line2="960" col2="2" start="181441" end="181442">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="961" col1="1" line2="961" col2="10" start="181630" end="181639">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="962" col1="1" line2="962" col2="11" start="181819" end="181829">#' @seealso</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="963" col1="1" line2="963" col2="33" start="182008" end="182040">#' \code{\link[destiny]{destiny}}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="964" col1="1" line2="964" col2="14" start="182197" end="182210">#' @references</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="965" col1="1" line2="965" col2="175" start="182386" end="182560">#' Haghverdi L, Buettner F, Theis FJ. Diffusion maps for high-dimensional single-cell analysis of differentiation data. Bioinformatics. 2015; doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btv325</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="966" col1="1" line2="966" col2="2" start="182575" end="182576">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="967" col1="1" line2="967" col2="12" start="182764" end="182775">#' @examples</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="968" col1="1" line2="968" col2="30" start="182953" end="182982">#' ## Set up an example SCESet</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="969" col1="1" line2="969" col2="28" start="183142" end="183169">#' data("sc_example_counts")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="970" col1="1" line2="970" col2="31" start="183331" end="183361">#' data("sc_example_cell_info")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="971" col1="1" line2="971" col2="63" start="183520" end="183582">#' pd &lt;- new("AnnotatedDataFrame", data = sc_example_cell_info)</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1113" col1="1" line2="1113" col2="80" start="210358" end="210437">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1114" col1="1" line2="1114" col2="11" start="210547" end="210557">### plotMDS</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1116" col1="1" line2="1116" col2="63" start="210925" end="210987">#' Produce a multidimensional scaling plot for an SCESet object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1117" col1="1" line2="1117" col2="2" start="211114" end="211115">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1118" col1="1" line2="1118" col2="68" start="211303" end="211370">#' #' Produce an MDS plot from the cell pairwise distance data in an</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1119" col1="1" line2="1119" col2="25" start="211492" end="211516">#' \code{SCESet} dataset.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1120" col1="1" line2="1120" col2="2" start="211681" end="211682">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1121" col1="1" line2="1121" col2="40" start="211870" end="211909">#' @param object an \code{SCESet} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1122" col1="1" line2="1122" col2="71" start="212059" end="212129">#' @param ncomponents numeric scalar indicating the number of principal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1123" col1="1" line2="1123" col2="78" start="212248" end="212325">#' components to plot, starting from the first principal component. Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1124" col1="1" line2="1124" col2="79" start="212437" end="212515">#' 2. If \code{ncomponents} is 2, then a scatterplot of PC2 vs PC1 is produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1125" col1="1" line2="1125" col2="80" start="212626" end="212705">#' If \code{ncomponents} is greater than 2, a pairs plots for the top components</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1126" col1="1" line2="1126" col2="80" start="212815" end="212894">#' is produced. NB: computing more than two components for t-SNE can become very</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1127" col1="1" line2="1127" col2="18" start="213004" end="213021">#' time consuming.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1128" col1="1" line2="1128" col2="83" start="213193" end="213275">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1129" col1="1" line2="1129" col2="83" start="213382" end="213464">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively, a </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1130" col1="1" line2="1130" col2="80" start="213571" end="213650">#' data frame with one column containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1131" col1="1" line2="1131" col2="82" start="213760" end="213841">#' @param shape_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1132" col1="1" line2="1132" col2="78" start="213949" end="214026">#' be used as a factor by which to define the shape of the points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1133" col1="1" line2="1133" col2="81" start="214138" end="214218">#' @param size_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1134" col1="1" line2="1134" col2="73" start="214327" end="214399">#' be used as a factor by which to define the size of points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1135" col1="1" line2="1135" col2="76" start="214516" end="214591">#' @param return_SCESet logical, should the function return an \code{SCESet}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1136" col1="1" line2="1136" col2="58" start="214705" end="214762">#' object with principal component values for cells in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1137" col1="1" line2="1137" col2="73" start="214894" end="214966">#' \code{reducedDimension} slot. Default is \code{FALSE}, in which case a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1138" col1="1" line2="1138" col2="36" start="215083" end="215118">#' \code{ggplot} object is returned.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1139" col1="1" line2="1139" col2="77" start="215272" end="215348">#' @param draw_plot logical, should the plot be drawn on the current graphics</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1140" col1="1" line2="1140" col2="79" start="215461" end="215539">#' device? Only used if \code{return_SCESet} is \code{TRUE}, otherwise the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1141" col1="1" line2="1141" col2="22" start="215650" end="215671">#' is always produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1142" col1="1" line2="1142" col2="75" start="215839" end="215913">#' @param exprs_values a string specifying the expression values to use for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1143" col1="1" line2="1143" col2="88" start="216028" end="216115">#' colouring the points, if \code{colour_by} or \code{size_by} are set as feature names.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1144" col1="1" line2="1144" col2="79" start="216217" end="216295">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1145" col1="1" line2="1145" col2="19" start="216406" end="216424">#' (default is 10).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1146" col1="1" line2="1146" col2="77" start="216595" end="216671">#' @param legend character, specifying how the legend(s) be shown? Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1147" col1="1" line2="1147" col2="80" start="216784" end="216863">#' \code{"auto"}, which hides legends that have only one level and shows others.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1148" col1="1" line2="1148" col2="74" start="216973" end="217046">#' Alternatives are "all" (show all legends) or "none" (hide all legends).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1149" col1="1" line2="1149" col2="51" start="217162" end="217212">#' @param ... arguments passed to S4 plotMDS method</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1150" col1="1" line2="1150" col2="2" start="217351" end="217352">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1151" col1="1" line2="1151" col2="69" start="217540" end="217608">#' @details The function \code{\link{cmdscale}} is used internally to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1152" col1="1" line2="1152" col2="59" start="217729" end="217787">#' compute the multidimensional scaling components to plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1153" col1="1" line2="1153" col2="2" start="217918" end="217919">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1154" col1="1" line2="1154" col2="79" start="218107" end="218185">#' @return If \code{return_SCESet} is \code{TRUE}, then the function returns an</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1155" col1="1" line2="1155" col2="69" start="218296" end="218364">#' \code{SCESet} object, otherwise it returns a \code{ggplot} object.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1156" col1="1" line2="1156" col2="16" start="218485" end="218500">#' @name plotMDS</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1268" col1="1" line2="1268" col2="18" start="239653" end="239670">### plotReducedDim</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1270" col1="1" line2="1270" col2="49" start="240031" end="240079">#' Plot reduced dimension representation of cells</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1271" col1="1" line2="1271" col2="2" start="240220" end="240221">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1272" col1="1" line2="1272" col2="80" start="240409" end="240488">#' @param object an \code{SCESet} object with a non-NULL \code{reducedDimension}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1273" col1="1" line2="1273" col2="8" start="240598" end="240605">#' slot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1274" col1="1" line2="1274" col2="79" start="240787" end="240865">#' @param df_to_plot data.frame containing a reduced dimension represenation of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1275" col1="1" line2="1275" col2="44" start="240976" end="241019">#' cells and optional metadata for the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1276" col1="1" line2="1276" col2="71" start="241165" end="241235">#' @param ncomponents numeric scalar indicating the number of principal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1277" col1="1" line2="1277" col2="78" start="241354" end="241431">#' components to plot, starting from the first principal component. Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1278" col1="1" line2="1278" col2="80" start="241543" end="241622">#' 2. If \code{ncomponents} is 2, then a scatterplot of Dimension 2 vs Dimension</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1279" col1="1" line2="1279" col2="80" start="241732" end="241811">#' 1 is produced. If \code{ncomponents} is greater than 2, a pairs plots for the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1280" col1="1" line2="1280" col2="31" start="241921" end="241951">#'  top dimensions is produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1281" col1="1" line2="1281" col2="83" start="242110" end="242192">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1282" col1="1" line2="1282" col2="83" start="242299" end="242381">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively, a </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1283" col1="1" line2="1283" col2="80" start="242488" end="242567">#' data frame with one column containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1284" col1="1" line2="1284" col2="82" start="242677" end="242758">#' @param shape_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1286" col1="1" line2="1286" col2="81" start="243055" end="243135">#' @param size_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1287" col1="1" line2="1287" col2="73" start="243244" end="243316">#' be used as a factor by which to define the size of points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1288" col1="1" line2="1288" col2="72" start="243433" end="243504">#' @param percentVar numeric vector giving the proportion of variance in</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1289" col1="1" line2="1289" col2="75" start="243622" end="243696">#' expression explained by each reduced dimension. Only expected to be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1290" col1="1" line2="1290" col2="60" start="243811" end="243870">#' internally in the \code{\link[scater]{plotPCA}} function.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1291" col1="1" line2="1291" col2="75" start="244000" end="244074">#' @param exprs_values a string specifying the expression values to use for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1292" col1="1" line2="1292" col2="88" start="244189" end="244276">#' colouring the points, if \code{colour_by} or \code{size_by} are set as feature names.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1293" col1="1" line2="1293" col2="79" start="244378" end="244456">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1294" col1="1" line2="1294" col2="19" start="244567" end="244585">#' (default is 10).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1295" col1="1" line2="1295" col2="77" start="244756" end="244832">#' @param legend character, specifying how the legend(s) be shown? Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1296" col1="1" line2="1296" col2="80" start="244945" end="245024">#' \code{"auto"}, which hides legends that have only one level and shows others.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1297" col1="1" line2="1297" col2="74" start="245134" end="245207">#' Alternatives are "all" (show all legends) or "none" (hide all legends).</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1547" col1="1" line2="1547" col2="33" start="292384" end="292416">### Plot cells in plate positions</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1549" col1="1" line2="1549" col2="32" start="292762" end="292793">#' Plot cells in plate positions</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1550" col1="1" line2="1550" col2="2" start="292951" end="292952">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1551" col1="1" line2="1551" col2="74" start="293140" end="293213">#' Plots cells in their position on a plate, coloured by phenotype data or</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1552" col1="1" line2="1552" col2="22" start="293329" end="293350">#' feature expression.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1553" col1="1" line2="1553" col2="2" start="293518" end="293519">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1554" col1="1" line2="1554" col2="80" start="293707" end="293786">#' @param object an \code{SCESet} object. If \code{object$plate_position} is not</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1555" col1="1" line2="1555" col2="76" start="293896" end="293971">#' \code{NULL}, then this will be used to define each cell's position on the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1556" col1="1" line2="1556" col2="65" start="294085" end="294149">#' plate, unless the \code{plate_position} argument is specified.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1557" col1="1" line2="1557" col2="78" start="294274" end="294351">#' @param plate_position optional character vector providing a position on the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1558" col1="1" line2="1558" col2="74" start="294463" end="294536">#' plate for each cell (e.g. A01, B12, etc, where letter indicates row and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1559" col1="1" line2="1559" col2="73" start="294652" end="294724">#' number indicates column). Specifying this argument overrides any plate</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1560" col1="1" line2="1560" col2="57" start="294841" end="294897">#' position information extracted from the SCESet object.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1561" col1="1" line2="1561" col2="83" start="295030" end="295112">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1562" col1="1" line2="1562" col2="83" start="295219" end="295301">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively, a </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1563" col1="1" line2="1563" col2="80" start="295408" end="295487">#' data frame with one column containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1564" col1="1" line2="1564" col2="76" start="295597" end="295672">#' @param x_position numeric vector providing x-axis positions for the cells</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1565" col1="1" line2="1565" col2="56" start="295786" end="295841">#' (ignored if \code{plate_position} is not \code{NULL})</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1566" col1="1" line2="1566" col2="76" start="295975" end="296050">#' @param y_position numeric vector providing y-axis positions for the cells</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1567" col1="1" line2="1567" col2="56" start="296164" end="296219">#' (ignored if \code{plate_position} is not \code{NULL})</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1568" col1="1" line2="1568" col2="75" start="296353" end="296427">#' @param exprs_values a string specifying the expression values to use for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1569" col1="1" line2="1569" col2="70" start="296542" end="296611">#' colouring the points, if \code{colour_by} is set as a feature name.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1570" col1="1" line2="1570" col2="79" start="296731" end="296809">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1571" col1="1" line2="1571" col2="19" start="296920" end="296938">#' (default is 10).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1572" col1="1" line2="1572" col2="77" start="297109" end="297185">#' @param legend character, specifying how the legend(s) be shown? Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1573" col1="1" line2="1573" col2="80" start="297298" end="297377">#' \code{"auto"}, which hides legends that have only one level and shows others.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1574" col1="1" line2="1574" col2="74" start="297487" end="297560">#' Alternatives are "all" (show all legends) or "none" (hide all legends).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1575" col1="1" line2="1575" col2="2" start="297676" end="297677">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1576" col1="1" line2="1576" col2="75" start="297865" end="297939">#' @details This function expects plate positions to be given in a charcter</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1577" col1="1" line2="1577" col2="75" start="298054" end="298128">#' format where a letter indicates the row on the plate and a numeric value</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1578" col1="1" line2="1578" col2="80" start="298243" end="298322">#' indicates the column. So each cell has a plate position such as "A01", "B12",</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1579" col1="1" line2="1579" col2="75" start="298432" end="298506">#' "K24" and so on. From these plate positions, the row is extracted as the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1580" col1="1" line2="1580" col2="78" start="298621" end="298698">#' letter, and the column as the numeric part. If \code{object$plate_position}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1581" col1="1" line2="1581" col2="76" start="298810" end="298885">#' or the \code{plate_position} argument are used to define plate positions,</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1582" col1="1" line2="1582" col2="75" start="298999" end="299073">#' then positions should be provided in this format. Alternatively, numeric</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1583" col1="1" line2="1583" col2="66" start="299188" end="299253">#' values to be used as x- and y-coordinates by supplying both the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1584" col1="1" line2="1584" col2="69" start="299377" end="299445">#' \code{x_position} and \code{y_position} arguments to the function.</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1681" col1="1" line2="1681" col2="80" start="317710" end="317789">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1683" col1="1" line2="1683" col2="75" start="318088" end="318162">#' Plot expression values for a set of features (e.g. genes or transcripts)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1684" col1="1" line2="1684" col2="2" start="318277" end="318278">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1685" col1="1" line2="1685" col2="66" start="318466" end="318531">#' @param object an SCESet object containing expression values and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1686" col1="1" line2="1686" col2="75" start="318655" end="318729">#' experimental information. Must have been appropriately prepared. For the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1687" col1="1" line2="1687" col2="71" start="318844" end="318914">#' \code{plotExpressionDefault} method, the \code{object} argument is a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1688" col1="1" line2="1688" col2="80" start="319033" end="319112">#' data.frame in 'long' format providing expression values for a set of features</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1689" col1="1" line2="1689" col2="77" start="319222" end="319298">#'  to plot, plus metadata used in the \code{aesth} argument, but this is not</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1690" col1="1" line2="1690" col2="39" start="319411" end="319449">#'  meant to be a user-level operation.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1691" col1="1" line2="1691" col2="65" start="319600" end="319664">#' @param features a character vector of feature names or Boolean</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1692" col1="1" line2="1692" col2="76" start="319789" end="319864">#' vector or numeric vector of indices indicating which features should have</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1693" col1="1" line2="1693" col2="34" start="319978" end="320011">#' their expression values plotted</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1694" col1="1" line2="1694" col2="79" start="320167" end="320245">#' @param x character string providing a column name of \code{pData(object)} or</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1695" col1="1" line2="1695" col2="72" start="320356" end="320427">#' a feature name (i.e. gene or transcript) to plot on the x-axis in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1696" col1="1" line2="1696" col2="80" start="320545" end="320624">#' expression plot(s). If a feature name, then expression values for the feature</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1697" col1="1" line2="1697" col2="50" start="320734" end="320783">#' will be plotted on the x-axis for each subplot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1698" col1="1" line2="1698" col2="78" start="320923" end="321000">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1699" col1="1" line2="1699" col2="75" start="321112" end="321186">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1700" col1="1" line2="1700" col2="63" start="321301" end="321363">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"norm_tpm"} (normalised TPM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1701" col1="1" line2="1701" col2="76" start="321490" end="321565">#' values), \code{"fpkm"} (FPKM values), \code{"norm_fpkm"} (normalised FPKM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1702" col1="1" line2="1702" col2="76" start="321679" end="321754">#' values), \code{"counts"} (counts for each feature), \code{"norm_counts"},</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1703" col1="1" line2="1703" col2="67" start="321868" end="321934">#' \code{"cpm"} (counts-per-million), \code{"norm_cpm"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1704" col1="1" line2="1704" col2="78" start="322057" end="322134">#' counts-per-million), \code{"exprs"} (whatever is in the \code{'exprs'} slot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1705" col1="1" line2="1705" col2="73" start="322246" end="322318">#' of the \code{SCESet} object; default), \code{"norm_exprs"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1706" col1="1" line2="1706" col2="78" start="322435" end="322512">#' expression values) or \code{"stand_exprs"} (standardised expression values)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1707" col1="1" line2="1707" col2="76" start="322624" end="322699">#' or any other slots that have been added to the \code{"assayData"} slot by</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1708" col1="1" line2="1708" col2="12" start="322813" end="322824">#' the user.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1709" col1="1" line2="1709" col2="75" start="323002" end="323076">#' @param colour_by optional character string supplying name of a column of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1710" col1="1" line2="1710" col2="75" start="323191" end="323265">#' \code{pData(object)} which will be used as a variable by which to colour</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1711" col1="1" line2="1711" col2="78" start="323380" end="323457">#' expression values on the plot. Alternatively, a data frame with one column,</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1712" col1="1" line2="1712" col2="68" start="323569" end="323636">#' containing a value for each cell that will be mapped to a colour.</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1715" col1="1" line2="1715" col2="78" start="324136" end="324213">#' points for expression values on the plot. Alternatively, a data frame with </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1716" col1="1" line2="1716" col2="49" start="324325" end="324373">#' one column containing values to map to shapes.</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1718" col1="1" line2="1718" col2="78" start="324703" end="324780">#' \code{pData(object)} which will be used as a variable to define the size of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1719" col1="1" line2="1719" col2="78" start="324892" end="324969">#' points for expression values on the plot. Alternatively, a data frame with </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1720" col1="1" line2="1720" col2="48" start="325081" end="325128">#' one column containing values to map to sizes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1721" col1="1" line2="1721" col2="70" start="325270" end="325339">#' @param ncol number of columns to be used for the panels of the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1722" col1="1" line2="1722" col2="80" start="325459" end="325538">#' @param xlab label for x-axis; if \code{NULL} (default), then \code{x} will be</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1723" col1="1" line2="1723" col2="27" start="325648" end="325674">#' used as the x-axis label</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1724" col1="1" line2="1724" col2="73" start="325837" end="325909">#' @param show_median logical, show the median for each group on the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1725" col1="1" line2="1725" col2="70" start="326026" end="326095">#' @param show_violin logical, show a violin plot for the distribution</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1726" col1="1" line2="1726" col2="29" start="326215" end="326243">#' for each group on the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1727" col1="1" line2="1727" col2="80" start="326404" end="326483">#' @param show_smooth logical, show a smoothed fit through the expression values</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1728" col1="1" line2="1728" col2="15" start="326593" end="326607">#'  on the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1729" col1="1" line2="1729" col2="82" start="326782" end="326863">#' @param alpha numeric value between 0 (completely transparent) and 1 (completely</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1730" col1="1" line2="1730" col2="68" start="326971" end="327038">#' solid) defining how transparent plotted points (cells) should be.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1731" col1="1" line2="1731" col2="77" start="327160" end="327236">#' Points are jittered horizontally if the x-axis value is categorical rather</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1732" col1="1" line2="1732" col2="38" start="327349" end="327386">#' than numeric to avoid overplotting.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1733" col1="1" line2="1733" col2="79" start="327538" end="327616">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1734" col1="1" line2="1734" col2="18" start="327727" end="327744">#' (default is 10)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1735" col1="1" line2="1735" col2="72" start="327916" end="327987">#' @param log2_values should the expression values be transformed to the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1736" col1="1" line2="1736" col2="73" start="328105" end="328177">#' log2-scale for plotting (with an offset of 1 to avoid logging zeroes)?</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1737" col1="1" line2="1737" col2="69" start="328294" end="328362">#' @param size numeric scalar optionally providing size for points if</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1738" col1="1" line2="1738" col2="78" start="328483" end="328560">#' \code{size_by} argument is not given. Default is \code{NULL}, in which case</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1739" col1="1" line2="1739" col2="33" start="328672" end="328704">#' \pkg{ggplot2} default is used.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1740" col1="1" line2="1740" col2="68" start="328861" end="328928">#' @param scales character scalar, should scales be fixed ("fixed"),</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1741" col1="1" line2="1741" col2="77" start="329050" end="329126">#' free ("free"), or free in one dimension ("free_x"; "free_y", the default).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1742" col1="1" line2="1742" col2="89" start="329239" end="329327">#' Passed to the \code{scales} argument in the \code{\link[ggplot2]{facet_wrap}} function</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1743" col1="1" line2="1743" col2="35" start="329428" end="329462">#' from the \code{ggplot2} package.</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2033" col1="1" line2="2033" col2="38" start="384238" end="384275">#' Plot metadata for cells or features</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2034" col1="1" line2="2034" col2="2" start="384427" end="384428">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2035" col1="1" line2="2035" col2="76" start="384616" end="384691">#' @param object a data.frame (or object that can be coerced to such) object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2036" col1="1" line2="2036" col2="42" start="384805" end="384846">#' containing metadata in columns to plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2037" col1="1" line2="2037" col2="73" start="384994" end="385066">#' @param aesth aesthetics function call to pass to ggplot. This function</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2038" col1="1" line2="2038" col2="76" start="385183" end="385258">#' expects at least x and y variables to be supplied. The default is to plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2039" col1="1" line2="2039" col2="46" start="385372" end="385417">#' total_features against log10(total_counts).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2040" col1="1" line2="2040" col2="80" start="385561" end="385640">#' @param shape numeric scalar to define the plotting shape. Ignored if shape is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2041" col1="1" line2="2041" col2="41" start="385750" end="385790">#' included in the \code{aesth} argument.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2042" col1="1" line2="2042" col2="75" start="385939" end="386013">#' @param alpha numeric scalar (in the interval 0 to 1) to define the alpha</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2043" col1="1" line2="2043" col2="78" start="386128" end="386205">#' level (transparency) of plotted points. Ignored if alpha is included in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2044" col1="1" line2="2044" col2="25" start="386317" end="386341">#' \code{aesth} argument.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2045" col1="1" line2="2045" col2="77" start="386506" end="386582">#' @param size numeric scalar to define the plotting size. Ignored if size is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2046" col1="1" line2="2046" col2="41" start="386695" end="386735">#' included in the \code{aesth} argument.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2047" col1="1" line2="2047" col2="79" start="386884" end="386962">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2048" col1="1" line2="2048" col2="18" start="387073" end="387090">#' (default is 10)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2049" col1="1" line2="2049" col2="2" start="387262" end="387263">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2050" col1="1" line2="2050" col2="80" start="387451" end="387530">#' @details Plot cell or feature metadata from an SCESet object. If one variable</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2051" col1="1" line2="2051" col2="75" start="387640" end="387714">#'  is supplied then a density plot will be returned. If both variables are</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2052" col1="1" line2="2052" col2="80" start="387829" end="387908">#' continuous (numeric) then a scatter plot will be returned. If one variable is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2053" col1="1" line2="2053" col2="79" start="388018" end="388096">#' discrete and one continuous then a violin plot with jittered points overlaid</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2054" col1="1" line2="2054" col2="78" start="388207" end="388284">#' will be returned. If both variables are discrete then a jitter plot will be</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2055" col1="1" line2="2055" col2="74" start="388396" end="388469">#' produced. The object returned is a ggplot object, so further layers and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2056" col1="1" line2="2056" col2="62" start="388585" end="388646">#' plotting options (titles, facets, themes etc) can be added.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2057" col1="1" line2="2057" col2="2" start="388774" end="388775">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2058" col1="1" line2="2058" col2="31" start="388963" end="388993">#' @return a ggplot plot object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2059" col1="1" line2="2059" col2="2" start="389152" end="389153">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2060" col1="1" line2="2060" col2="18" start="389341" end="389358">#' @import viridis</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2061" col1="1" line2="2061" col2="10" start="389530" end="389539">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2062" col1="1" line2="2062" col2="2" start="389719" end="389720">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2063" col1="1" line2="2063" col2="12" start="389908" end="389919">#' @examples</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2216" col1="1" line2="2216" col2="44" start="418825" end="418868">#' Plot phenotype data from an SCESet object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2217" col1="1" line2="2217" col2="2" start="419014" end="419015">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2218" col1="1" line2="2218" col2="66" start="419203" end="419268">#' @param object an SCESet object containing expression values and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2219" col1="1" line2="2219" col2="67" start="419392" end="419458">#' experimental information. Must have been appropriately prepared.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2220" col1="1" line2="2220" col2="73" start="419581" end="419653">#' @param aesth aesthetics function call to pass to ggplot. This function</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2221" col1="1" line2="2221" col2="76" start="419770" end="419845">#' expects at least x and y variables to be supplied. The default is to plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2222" col1="1" line2="2222" col2="46" start="419959" end="420004">#' total_features against log10(total_counts).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2223" col1="1" line2="2223" col2="67" start="420148" end="420214">#' @param ... arguments passed to \code{\link{plotMetadata}}, e.g. </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2224" col1="1" line2="2224" col2="62" start="420337" end="420398">#' \code{theme_size}, \code{size}, \code{alpha}, \code{shape}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2225" col1="1" line2="2225" col2="2" start="420526" end="420527">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2226" col1="1" line2="2226" col2="73" start="420715" end="420787">#' @details Plot phenotype data from an SCESet object. If one variable is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2227" col1="1" line2="2227" col2="71" start="420904" end="420974">#' supplied then a density plot will be returned. If both variables are</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2228" col1="1" line2="2228" col2="80" start="421093" end="421172">#' continuous (numeric) then a scatter plot will be returned. If one variable is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2229" col1="1" line2="2229" col2="79" start="421282" end="421360">#' discrete and one continuous then a violin plot with jittered points overlaid</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2230" col1="1" line2="2230" col2="78" start="421471" end="421548">#' will be returned. If both variables are discrete then a jitter plot will be</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2231" col1="1" line2="2231" col2="74" start="421660" end="421733">#' produced. The object returned is a ggplot object, so further layers and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2232" col1="1" line2="2232" col2="62" start="421849" end="421910">#' plotting options (titles, facets, themes etc) can be added.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2233" col1="1" line2="2233" col2="2" start="422038" end="422039">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2234" col1="1" line2="2234" col2="31" start="422227" end="422257">#' @return a ggplot plot object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2235" col1="1" line2="2235" col2="2" start="422416" end="422417">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2236" col1="1" line2="2236" col2="10" start="422605" end="422614">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2237" col1="1" line2="2237" col2="12" start="422794" end="422805">#' @examples</COMMENT>
