  <COMMENT line1="2272" col1="1" line2="2272" col2="80" start="429409" end="429488">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2274" col1="1" line2="2274" col2="49" start="429787" end="429835">#' Plot feature (gene) data from an SCESet object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2275" col1="1" line2="2275" col2="2" start="429976" end="429977">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2276" col1="1" line2="2276" col2="66" start="430165" end="430230">#' @param object an SCESet object containing expression values and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2277" col1="1" line2="2277" col2="67" start="430354" end="430420">#' experimental information. Must have been appropriately prepared.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2278" col1="1" line2="2278" col2="73" start="430543" end="430615">#' @param aesth aesthetics function call to pass to ggplot. This function</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2279" col1="1" line2="2279" col2="79" start="430732" end="430810">#' expects at least x and y variables to be supplied. The default is to produce</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2280" col1="1" line2="2280" col2="69" start="430921" end="430989">#' a density plot of number of cells expressing the feature (requires</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2281" col1="1" line2="2281" col2="74" start="431110" end="431183">#' \code{calculateQCMetrics} to have been run on the SCESet object prior).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2282" col1="1" line2="2282" col2="67" start="431299" end="431365">#' @param ... arguments passed to \code{\link{plotMetadata}}, e.g. </COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2283" col1="1" line2="2283" col2="62" start="431488" end="431549">#' \code{theme_size}, \code{size}, \code{alpha}, \code{shape}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2284" col1="1" line2="2284" col2="2" start="431677" end="431678">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2285" col1="1" line2="2285" col2="78" start="431866" end="431943">#' @details Plot feature (gene) data from an SCESet object. If one variable is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2286" col1="1" line2="2286" col2="71" start="432055" end="432125">#' supplied then a density plot will be returned. If both variables are</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2287" col1="1" line2="2287" col2="80" start="432244" end="432323">#' continuous (numeric) then a scatter plot will be returned. If one variable is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2288" col1="1" line2="2288" col2="79" start="432433" end="432511">#' discrete and one continuous then a violin plot with jittered points overlaid</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2289" col1="1" line2="2289" col2="78" start="432622" end="432699">#' will be returned. If both variables are discrete then a jitter plot will be</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2290" col1="1" line2="2290" col2="74" start="432811" end="432884">#' produced. The object returned is a ggplot object, so further layers and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2291" col1="1" line2="2291" col2="62" start="433000" end="433061">#' plotting options (titles, facets, themes etc) can be added.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2292" col1="1" line2="2292" col2="2" start="433189" end="433190">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2293" col1="1" line2="2293" col2="31" start="433378" end="433408">#' @return a ggplot plot object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2294" col1="1" line2="2294" col2="2" start="433567" end="433568">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2295" col1="1" line2="2295" col2="10" start="433756" end="433765">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2296" col1="1" line2="2296" col2="12" start="433945" end="433956">#' @examples</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2297" col1="1" line2="2297" col2="28" start="434134" end="434161">#' data("sc_example_counts")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2298" col1="1" line2="2298" col2="31" start="434323" end="434353">#' data("sc_example_cell_info")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2299" col1="1" line2="2299" col2="63" start="434512" end="434574">#' pd &lt;- new("AnnotatedDataFrame", data = sc_example_cell_info)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2300" col1="1" line2="2300" col2="77" start="434701" end="434777">#' example_sceset &lt;- newSCESet(countData = sc_example_counts, phenoData = pd)</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2319" col1="1" line2="2319" col2="40" start="438292" end="438331">### Multiplot function for ggplot2 plots</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2321" col1="1" line2="2321" col2="43" start="438670" end="438712">#' Multiple plot function for ggplot2 plots</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2322" col1="1" line2="2322" col2="2" start="438859" end="438860">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2323" col1="1" line2="2323" col2="66" start="439048" end="439113">#' Place multiple \code{\link[ggplot2]{ggplot}} plots on one page.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2324" col1="1" line2="2324" col2="2" start="439237" end="439238">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2325" col1="1" line2="2325" col2="78" start="439426" end="439503">#' @param ...,plotlist ggplot objects can be passed in ..., or to plotlist (as</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2326" col1="1" line2="2326" col2="28" start="439615" end="439642">#' a list of ggplot objects)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2327" col1="1" line2="2327" col2="72" start="439804" end="439875">#' @param cols numeric scalar giving the number of columns in the layout</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2328" col1="1" line2="2328" col2="75" start="439993" end="440067">#' @param layout a matrix specifying the layout. If present, \code{cols} is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2329" col1="1" line2="2329" col2="11" start="440182" end="440192">#' ignored.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2330" col1="1" line2="2330" col2="2" start="440371" end="440372">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2331" col1="1" line2="2331" col2="43" start="440560" end="440602">#' @details If the layout is something like</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2332" col1="1" line2="2332" col2="76" start="440749" end="440824">#' \code{matrix(c(1,2,3,3), nrow=2, byrow=TRUE)}, then plot 1 will go in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2333" col1="1" line2="2333" col2="77" start="440938" end="441014">#' upper left, 2 will go in the upper right, and 3 will go all the way across</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2334" col1="1" line2="2334" col2="77" start="441127" end="441203">#' the bottom. There is no way to tweak the relative heights or widths of the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2335" col1="1" line2="2335" col2="55" start="441316" end="441370">#' plots with this simple function. It was adapted from</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2336" col1="1" line2="2336" col2="80" start="441505" end="441584">#' \url{http://www.cookbook-r.com/Graphs/Multiple_graphs_on_one_page_(ggplot2)/}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2337" col1="1" line2="2337" col2="2" start="441694" end="441695">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2338" col1="1" line2="2338" col2="38" start="441883" end="441920">#' @return a \code{ggplot} plot object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2339" col1="1" line2="2339" col2="2" start="442072" end="442073">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2340" col1="1" line2="2340" col2="32" start="442261" end="442292">#' @importFrom grid grid.newpage</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2341" col1="1" line2="2341" col2="32" start="442450" end="442481">#' @importFrom grid pushViewport</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2342" col1="1" line2="2342" col2="28" start="442639" end="442666">#' @importFrom grid viewport</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2343" col1="1" line2="2343" col2="31" start="442828" end="442858">#' @importFrom grid grid.layout</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2344" col1="1" line2="2344" col2="10" start="443017" end="443026">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2345" col1="1" line2="2345" col2="12" start="443206" end="443217">#' @examples</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2346" col1="1" line2="2346" col2="19" start="443395" end="443413">#' library(ggplot2)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2347" col1="1" line2="2347" col2="73" start="443584" end="443656">#' ## This example uses the ChickWeight dataset, which comes with ggplot2</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2348" col1="1" line2="2348" col2="16" start="443773" end="443788">#' ## First plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2349" col1="1" line2="2349" col2="87" start="443962" end="444048">#' p1 &lt;- ggplot(ChickWeight, aes(x = Time, y = weight, colour = Diet, group = Chick)) +</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2350" col1="1" line2="2350" col2="19" start="444151" end="444169">#'    geom_line() +</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2351" col1="1" line2="2351" col2="51" start="444340" end="444390">#'    ggtitle("Growth curve for individual chicks")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2352" col1="1" line2="2352" col2="17" start="444529" end="444545">#' ## Second plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2353" col1="1" line2="2353" col2="72" start="444718" end="444789">#' p2 &lt;- ggplot(ChickWeight, aes(x = Time, y = weight, colour = Diet)) +</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2354" col1="1" line2="2354" col2="30" start="444907" end="444936">#'    geom_point(alpha = .3) +</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2355" col1="1" line2="2355" col2="41" start="445096" end="445136">#'    geom_smooth(alpha = .2, size = 1) +</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2356" col1="1" line2="2356" col2="45" start="445285" end="445329">#'    ggtitle("Fitted growth curve per diet")</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2358" col1="1" line2="2358" col2="82" start="445663" end="445744">#' p3 &lt;- ggplot(subset(ChickWeight, Time == 21), aes(x = weight, colour = Diet)) +</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2359" col1="1" line2="2359" col2="22" start="445852" end="445873">#'    geom_density() +</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2363" col1="1" line2="2363" col2="56" start="446608" end="446663">#'     geom_histogram(colour = "black", binwidth = 50) +</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2368" col1="1" line2="2368" col2="38" start="447553" end="447590">#' multiplot(p1, p2, p3, p4, cols = 2)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2369" col1="1" line2="2369" col2="2" start="447742" end="447743">#'</COMMENT>
  <expr line1="2370" col1="1" line2="2401" col2="1" start="447931" end="453790">

      <FUNCTION line1="2370" col1="14" line2="2370" col2="21" start="447944" end="447951">function</FUNCTION>
      <OP-LEFT-PAREN line1="2370" col1="22" line2="2370" col2="22" start="447952" end="447952">(</OP-LEFT-PAREN>
      <SYMBOL_FORMALS line1="2370" col1="23" line2="2370" col2="25" start="447953" end="447955">...</SYMBOL_FORMALS>

      <expr line1="2370" col1="39" line2="2370" col2="42" start="447969" end="447972">

      <OP-COMMA line1="2370" col1="43" line2="2370" col2="43" start="447973" end="447973">,</OP-COMMA>

      <OP-COMMA line1="2370" col1="53" line2="2370" col2="53" start="447983" end="447983">,</OP-COMMA>
      <SYMBOL_FORMALS line1="2370" col1="55" line2="2370" col2="60" start="447985" end="447990">layout</SYMBOL_FORMALS>
      <EQ_FORMALS line1="2370" col1="62" line2="2370" col2="62" start="447992" end="447992">=</EQ_FORMALS>
      <expr line1="2370" col1="64" line2="2370" col2="67" start="447994" end="447997">

      </expr>
      <OP-RIGHT-PAREN line1="2370" col1="68" line2="2370" col2="68" start="447998" end="447998">)</OP-RIGHT-PAREN>
      <expr line1="2370" col1="70" line2="2401" col2="1" start="448000" end="453790">

  <COMMENT line1="2405" col1="1" line2="2405" col2="45" start="454546" end="454590">### Plot expression against transcript length</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2408" col1="1" line2="2408" col2="44" start="455113" end="455156">#' Plot expression against transcript length</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2409" col1="1" line2="2409" col2="2" start="455302" end="455303">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2410" col1="1" line2="2410" col2="80" start="455491" end="455570">#' Plot expression values from an SCESet object against transcript length values</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2411" col1="1" line2="2411" col2="59" start="455680" end="455738">#' defined in the SCESet object or supplied as an argument.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2412" col1="1" line2="2412" col2="2" start="455869" end="455870">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2413" col1="1" line2="2413" col2="47" start="456058" end="456104">#' @param object an \code{\link{SCESet}} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2414" col1="1" line2="2414" col2="80" start="456247" end="456326">#' @param tx_length transcript lengths to plot on the x-axis. Can be one of: (1)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2415" col1="1" line2="2415" col2="80" start="456436" end="456515">#' the name of a column of \code{fData(object)} containing the transcript length</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2416" col1="1" line2="2416" col2="79" start="456625" end="456703">#' values, or (2) the name of an element of \code{assayData(object)} containing</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2417" col1="1" line2="2417" col2="80" start="456814" end="456893">#' a matrix of transcript length values, or (3) a numeric vector of length equal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2418" col1="1" line2="2418" col2="63" start="457003" end="457065">#' to the number of rows of \code{object} (number of features).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2419" col1="1" line2="2419" col2="78" start="457192" end="457269">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2420" col1="1" line2="2420" col2="75" start="457381" end="457455">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2421" col1="1" line2="2421" col2="63" start="457570" end="457632">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"norm_tpm"} (normalised TPM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2422" col1="1" line2="2422" col2="76" start="457759" end="457834">#' values), \code{"fpkm"} (FPKM values), \code{"norm_fpkm"} (normalised FPKM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2423" col1="1" line2="2423" col2="76" start="457948" end="458023">#' values), \code{"counts"} (counts for each feature), \code{"norm_counts"},</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2424" col1="1" line2="2424" col2="67" start="458137" end="458203">#' \code{"cpm"} (counts-per-million), \code{"norm_cpm"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2425" col1="1" line2="2425" col2="78" start="458326" end="458403">#' counts-per-million), \code{"exprs"} (whatever is in the \code{'exprs'} slot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2426" col1="1" line2="2426" col2="73" start="458515" end="458587">#' of the \code{SCESet} object; default), \code{"norm_exprs"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2427" col1="1" line2="2427" col2="78" start="458704" end="458781">#' expression values) or \code{"stand_exprs"} (standardised expression values)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2428" col1="1" line2="2428" col2="76" start="458893" end="458968">#' or any other slots that have been added to the \code{"assayData"} slot by</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2429" col1="1" line2="2429" col2="12" start="459082" end="459093">#' the user.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2430" col1="1" line2="2430" col2="75" start="459271" end="459345">#' @param colour_by optional character string supplying name of a column of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2431" col1="1" line2="2431" col2="75" start="459460" end="459534">#' \code{fData(object)} which will be used as a variable by which to colour</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2432" col1="1" line2="2432" col2="67" start="459649" end="459715">#' expression values on the plot. Alternatively, a data frame with </COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2448" col1="1" line2="2448" col2="82" start="462673" end="462754">#' @param alpha numeric value between 0 (completely transparent) and 1 (completely</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2449" col1="1" line2="2449" col2="68" start="462862" end="462929">#' solid) defining how transparent plotted points (cells) should be.</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2453" col1="1" line2="2453" col2="18" start="463618" end="463635">#' (default is 10)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2454" col1="1" line2="2454" col2="72" start="463807" end="463878">#' @param log2_values should the expression values be transformed to the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2455" col1="1" line2="2455" col2="73" start="463996" end="464068">#' log2-scale for plotting (with an offset of 1 to avoid logging zeroes)?</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2456" col1="1" line2="2456" col2="69" start="464185" end="464253">#' @param size numeric scalar optionally providing size for points if</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2457" col1="1" line2="2457" col2="78" start="464374" end="464451">#' \code{size_by} argument is not given. Default is \code{NULL}, in which case</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2458" col1="1" line2="2458" col2="33" start="464563" end="464595">#' \pkg{ggplot2} default is used.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2459" col1="1" line2="2459" col2="79" start="464752" end="464830">#' @param se logical, should standard errors be shown (default \code{TRUE}) for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2460" col1="1" line2="2460" col2="87" start="464941" end="465027">#' the smoothed fit through the cells. (Ignored if \code{show_smooth} is \code{FALSE}).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2461" col1="1" line2="2461" col2="2" start="465130" end="465131">#'</COMMENT>
